intro: Beckera schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian bean tree, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, woody stem and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Beckera schimperi is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native region.
